quests.quest_description: Master the types of bones, their structure, and their cell types!

questions.question:
Consist of a shaft and a variable number of extremities or epiphyses (ends)
 ex: femur, tibia, fibula, humerus

Somewhat cubed shaped; nearly equal in length and width 
 ex: carpal and tarsal bones

Generally thin and composed of two nearly parallel plates of compact bone tissue 
 ex: cranial bones, sternum, ribs

Have complex shapes and cannot be grouped into any other category 
 ex: vertebrae, hip bones, certain facial bones, calcaneus

Develop in certain tendons where there is considerable friction, tension, and physical stretch 
 ex: patella
Small bones located in sutures (joints) between certain cranial bones
Bone shaft/body; makes up the long, cylindrical portion of the bone
Proximal and distal ends of the bone
Regions between the diaphysis and epiphyses
Thin layer of hyaline cartilage covering the part of the bone that forms a joint
Tough connective tissue sheath that surrounds the bone surface
Hollow cylindrical space containing fatty yellow bone marrow
Thin membrane that lines the medullary cavity

groups.group_name: Cell Types and Types of Bone Tissue

questions.question: Stem cells
Bone-BUILIDNG cells that synthesize collagen
Mature bone cells that help maintain bone homeostasis
Bone-degrading cells that release lysosomal enzymes and acids
Found beneath the periosteum of all bone and helps the bone resist the stress produced by weight and movement
repeating structural units which compact bone is comprised of
Located in the interior of the bone and is used for the storage of bone marrow
structure of spongy bone: consists of lamellae that arranged in irregular pattern of thin columns
Primary source of new blood cells located between the trabeculae of certain bones
Comprised of adipocytes and located in the diaphysis of long bones
